solution_line_template: If John gave his fiancee a ${ring_cost} ring on their engagement day, a ${car_cost} car as a gift on their wedding day, the total cost for the two presents is ${ring_cost}+${car_cost}=$<<{ring_cost}+{car_cost}={initial_presents_cost}>>{initial_presents_cost}.
He also gave his fiancee a diamond brace twice as expensive as the ring costing {multiplier_brace}*${ring_cost}=$<<{multiplier_brace}*{ring_cost}={brace_cost}>>{brace_cost}
The total worth of the presents John gave to his fiancee is ${initial_presents_cost}+${brace_cost} =$<<{initial_presents_cost}+{brace_cost}={total_worth}>>{total_worth}
